citation.article-title: Transfer of Haemophilus equigenitalis Taylor et al. 1978 to the genus Taylorella gen. nov. as Taylorella equigenitalis comb. nov.

p.s: Taylorella (in honor of C.E.D. Taylor for his contribution to the understanding of the characteristics of this organism)
Gram-negative rod, often approaching coccobacillary form.
Non motile; no formation of endospores.
No growth on ordinary media and very poor, if any, growth observed on blood agar.
The best growth is obtained on chocolate agar, but no stimulation of growth with X- and V-factors is observed.
Optimum temperature for growth, 35째-37째C range usually 30째-37째C
Acid is not produced from carbohydrates; negative in glucosidase tests.
Oxidase, catalase, phosphatase, and phosphoamidase produced.
Lysine and ornithine decarboxylases, arginine dihydrolase, gelatinase, lipase, urease, and deoxyribonuclease are not produced.
The G+C content of DNA is about 36.5 mol% (Tm).
